title: How to Modify Font Properties of the Text in a PDF

steps.title: Make sure that you have the paid version of Adobe Acrobat.
steps.content: Make sure that you have the paid version of Adobe Acrobat. The Adobe Acrobat Reader app that many people have can open PDFs, but not edit them. In order to edit PDFs, you must have Adobe Acrobat Pro. You can also download a free trial of Adobe Acrobat from Adobe's download page to temporarily use these features for free.

steps.title: Open your PDF in Adobe Acrobat.
steps.content: Open your PDF in Adobe Acrobat. If Adobe Acrobat is your computer's default PDF reader, just double-click the PDF that you want to open. If Adobe Acrobat isn't your computer's default PDF reader, open Adobe Acrobat, click File , click Open... , select your PDF, and click Open .

steps.title: Click Tools.
steps.content: Click Tools . It's a tab in the upper-left side of the Adobe Acrobat window.

steps.title: Click Edit PDF.
steps.content: Click Edit PDF . This pink icon is near the top of the Tools tab. Doing so will open a sidebar to the right of the PDF.

steps.title: Select text to edit.
steps.content: Select text to edit. Find the text that you want to edit, then click and drag your mouse across the text to select it.

steps.title: Edit the text.
steps.content: Edit the text. Using the tools on the right side of the window, you can change the following properties: Font - Click the drop-down box below "FORMAT", then click the font that you want to use. Size - Click the drop-down box with a number in it, then click a larger or smaller number. You can also type in a number to create a custom size. Color - Click the colored box to the right of the numbered box, then click a new color.

steps.title: Save your changes.
steps.content: Save your changes. Click File , then click Save in the drop-down menu. You can also select Save As to change the file's name and/or where it's saved on your computer.

steps.title: Open the PDFescape website.
steps.content: Open the PDFescape website. Go to https://www.pdfescape.com/ .

steps.title: Click Free Online.
steps.content: Click Free Online . It's a red button on the left side of the page.

steps.title: Click Upload PDF to PDFescape.
steps.content: Click Upload PDF to PDFescape . This link is near the top of the page. Doing so opens a window.

steps.title: Click Choose File.
steps.content: Click Choose File . It's a grey button on the left side of the window. A File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac) window will open.

steps.title: Select a PDF.
steps.content: Select a PDF. Click the name of a PDF that you want to edit to select it. You may first have to click the PDF's folder location on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. This will open your PDF on the PDFescape website.

steps.title: Click the Whiteout tab.
steps.content: Click the Whiteout tab. You'll find this in the upper-left side of the page.

steps.title: White out text that you want to replace.
steps.content: White out text that you want to replace. Click and drag your mouse from the top-left corner of the text that you want to replace down to the bottom-right corner of the text. A white box will appear over the text.

steps.title: Click the Text tab.
steps.content: Click the Text tab. It's in the upper-left side of the page.

steps.title: Create a new text field.
steps.content: Create a new text field. Click the far-left side of the whited-out section.

steps.title: Select text properties.
steps.content: Select text properties. In the toolbar at the top of the page, change any of the following options: Font - Click the current font's name, then click the font that you want to use in the drop-down menu. Size - Click the current number to the right of the font, then click the number that you want to use. The larger the number, the larger the text. Formatting - Click B to create bold text, click I to create italic text, or click U to create underlined text. Color - Click the "Color" box, then click a text color in the drop-down box.

steps.title: Enter your text.
steps.content: Enter your text. Type in the text that you want to use to replace the old text. The text that you type here should use all of your selected text properties. You can also type in text, select it, and then change text properties.

steps.title: Download your edited PDF.
steps.content: Download your edited PDF. Click the green downward-facing arrow on the left side of the page. Your edited PDF will download to your browser's default "Downloads" location.
